actions: Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.
Committee on Armed Services. Hearings held.
Committee on Armed Services. Ordered to be reported favorably.
Reported by Senator Levin, Committee on Armed Services, without printed report.
Placed on Senate Executive Calendar. Calendar No. 10. Subject to nominee's commitment to respond to requests to appear and testify before any duly constituted committee of the Senate.
Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate.
By unanimous consent agreement, vote on cloture motion today.
Cloture not invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 58
Motion by Senator Reid to reconsider the vote by which cloture was not invoked on the nomination (Roll Vote No. 21) entered in Senate.
By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote on cloture motion, upon reconsideration, on 02-26-13.
Motion by Senator Reid to reconsider the vote by which the motion to invoke cloture on the nomination was not invoked (Roll Call Vote No. 21) agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Upon reconsideration, cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 71
By unanimous consent agreement, debate and vote today.
Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 58
name: Charles Timothy Hagel
nominee: Charles Timothy Hagel, of Nebraska, to be Secretary of Defense
